title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Housing (Domestic Waste Water
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Housing (Domestic Waste Water 
Treatment Systems Grant under the National Inspection Plan) Regulations
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited housing (domestic waste water treatment system grant national inspection plan) regulation

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: Commencement

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 2. These Regulations will come into operation on 1 January 2024.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations will come into operation on 1 January 2024. 

Interpretation

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations— 

“approved cost” in relation to the works for the remediation, repair, upgrade or 
replacement of a domestic waste water treatment system, means the cost 
assessed by the housing authority to be the reasonable cost of carrying out the 
works, or the actual cost of carrying out the works, whichever is the lesser; 

“Department” means the Department of Housing, Local Government and 
Heritage; 

“domestic waste water” has the same meaning as given to it under Part 1, 
Section 2 of the Water Services Act; 

“domestic waste water treatment system” has the same meaning as given to it 
under Part 4A, Section 70A of the Water Services Act; 

“information” under these Regulations means any personal data or information 
extracted from that data, obtained by a housing authority from an application 
by an individual solely for the purpose of payment of a grant under these 
Regulations; 

“Minister” means the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage; 

“normal place of residence”, in relation to an individual who makes an 
application under these Regulations, means that the house is occupied by the 
applicant as their normal place of residence; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 24th November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [562] 3 

“personal data” has the same meaning as it has in the General Data Protection 
Regulation; 

“Water Services Act” means the Water Services Act 2007, as amended. 

Grant towards works for the remediation, repair, upgrade or replacement of 
domestic waste water treatment systems

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 4. (1) A housing authority may pay a grant to a person for carrying out
text_raw:
4. (1) A housing authority may pay a grant to a person for carrying out 
works for the remediation, repair, upgrade or replacement of a domestic waste 
water treatment system serving a house, where such works arise directly from 
an inspection carried out and subsequent issue of an advisory notice under 
Section 70H of the Water Services Act. 

(2) A grant under these Regulations will not exceed 85 per cent of the 

approved cost, subject to a maximum grant of €12,000. 

(3) Where a grant is paid under these Regulations, the Minister will pay the 

housing authority 100 per cent of the grant paid. 

(4) The Minister may from time to time issue guidelines to housing 

authorities in relation to the operation of the grant scheme. 

Non Qualifying Works
text_norm: 4 (1) housing authority may pay grant person carrying work remediation repair upgrade replacement domestic waste water treatment system serving house work arise directly inspection carried subsequent issue advisory notice section 70h water service act (2) grant regulation exceed 85 per cent approved cost subject maximum grant eur12 000 (3) grant paid regulation minister pay housing authority 100 per cent grant paid (4) minister may time time issue guideline housing authority relation operation grant scheme non qualifying work

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 5. A grant under these regulations will not be paid towards the costs of
text_raw:
5. A grant under these regulations will not be paid towards the costs of 
maintaining, servicing or de-sludging a domestic waste water treatment system. 

Further Conditions
text_norm: 5 grant regulation paid towards cost maintaining servicing de-sludging domestic waste water treatment system condition

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 6. (1) A grant under these Regulations will not be paid unless—
text_raw:
6. (1) A grant under these Regulations will not be paid unless— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

a notice has been issued under Section 70H(17) of the Water 
Services Act; 

the house concerned is occupied by the applicant as their normal 
place of residence; 

the application relates to a domestic waste water treatment 
system serving a house; 

an application for payment is accompanied by an original receipt 
for the total amount paid, which includes an itemised list of the 
works carried out and the costs associated with each item; and, 

in respect of the contractor carrying out the works, the housing 
authority is furnished with a Tax Clearance Access Number 
(TCAN) and Tax Reference Number issued by the Revenue 
Commissioners to the contractor, or proof of Tax Clearance 
status from the Revenue On-Line Service (ROS). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [562] 

Sharing of Information

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 7. A Housing Authority holding information, as defined under these
text_raw:
7. A Housing Authority holding information, as defined under these 
Regulations, may share that information with the Department only for the 
purposes of determining entitlement to the grant in accordance with these 
Regulations. 

Revocation
text_norm: 7 housing authority holding information defined regulation may share information department purpose determining entitlement grant accordance regulation revocation

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: 8. The Housing (Domestic Waste Water Treatment Systems Financial
text_raw:
8. The Housing (Domestic Waste Water Treatment Systems Financial 
Assistance) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 184 of 2020) and the Domestic Waste 
Water Treatment Systems (Financial Assistance) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 
222/2013) are revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 November, 2023. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [562] 5

title: Housing Act 1966 (S.I. No. 21 of 1966), as amended, Section 6 of the Housing
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for changes to an existing grant scheme, available 
to householders to carry out works to defective Domestic Waste Water 
Treatment Systems, which have failed a local authority inspection under the 
National Inspection Plan. The changes will be effective from 1 January 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [562]
